"Flashlight Finder" - A smartphone app that uses GPS technology to help users locate their lost flashlight or find the nearest one. Users can simply enter their location and the app will show them a list of nearby flashlights along with their distance and direction. This can be especially helpful in emergency situations where time is of the essence. Confidence score: 0.9

"Flashlight Buddy" - A social media platform that connects people who own flashlights with those who need them. Users can create profiles and list their flashlights along with their location and availability. Others can then request to borrow a flashlight or offer their own for rent. This can be a great way to help others of darkness and foster a sense of community. Confidence score: 0.8

"Flashlight Genius" - An AI-powered flashlight that uses machine learning to optimize its performance based on the user's needs. For example, if the user is reading a book, the flashlight will adjust its brightness and color temperature to provide the best reading experience. This can be a great way to make the most out of your flashlight and enhance your overall experience. Confidence score: 0.7

"Flashlight Hacks" - A website or app that provides users with creative ways to use their flashlight. For example, users can learn how to use their flashlight as a magnifying glass, a makeshift camera flash, or a makeshift strobe light. This can be a great way to get more out of your flashlight and make it a versatile tool for a variety of tasks. Confidence score: 0.6

"Flashlight Art" - A series of art installations that use flashlights to create unique and visually striking sculptures or installations. These installations can be set up in public spaces or galleries and can be a great way to showcase the beauty and versatility of flashlights. Confidence score: 0.5
